content.description: This route starts about 15 to the left of Levitation. Climb to the right of the corner by about 6 feet. Use small sidepulls and crimps to gain a decent ledge then follow thin crack to another ledge and take it to the top.
content.protection: If Rhoads leads this before me I'll quit climbing.

content.description: Corner with small holds at first.
content.location: The Guillotine Wall, right of Annie's Overhang

content.description:
#52 on page 99 of Climbers Guide to Devils Lake. Described as: "Narrow face with small holds". Everyone agreed this was a 5.8+++, it's harder than most Devils Lake 5.8s. Do not use either corners of the face or you are off route. It's a bare climb with small holds, two ledges to rest on, nothing more. 

  I named it The Pike as it's part of The Guillotine, and what's left to do with a decapitated head? Put it on The Pike.
content.protection: Top rope it with ease, climb does not lend itself well to lead climbing.
content.location: In between The Gopher and Guillotine East

content.description:
Step up on the initial, big footholds, then wonder what to do next.  A devious puzzle. 

  The answer seems to be:  use crimps and foot-chips to get your foot into the large, sloping incut.  Stand up and reach for a large hold at the top of the slab.  Get your fingers in the horizontal out on the right face (the first good gear!), and continue straight up or move over to the right.
content.protection: A couple of pieces in the 1/4" to 3/4" range.

content.description: Probably the best of the short, unnamed routes on the east side of the Guillotine. Start by laying back or jamming the crack, gain a small alcove, then use face holds or jam your way to top.
content.protection: Standard rack, top rope, or pads
content.location: East side of the Guillotine, about 50 feet to the right of Beginner's Nose. Route 41(?) in Swartling/Mayer.

content.description: Levitation is an inside corner system on the left side of the Guillotine wall- the corner system to the left of Labor Pains (5.10b). Get off the ground, crux, and move through the series of low roofs using good jams and stemming. A 5.9 variation goes up the left face after pulling the first roof. This climb is a good lead for those just breaking into the trad game. Dare I to say that this might be harder if face holds aren't used and only jams employed to move over the roofs?
content.location: Left side of the Guillotine wall.

content.description: Climb the offwidth crack to the right of Broken Boulders. Guide book says 5.4 if you jam your left leg in the crack, 5.7 if done as a pure layback.  I have climbed approximately 60 routes at Devil's Lake so I know the ratings are stiff here, but this route is in the running for one of the hardest 5.4's on the planet.  I will go back and lead it before passing final judgement.
content.protection: Light rack on the bigger side.  I have not lead this one yet.
content.location: The route is just to the right of Broken Boulders. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Pass Broken Boulders and look for the offwidth crack to the right. Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Labor Pains is the route located on the central portion of the Guillotine wall and begins on a precarious platform. Start at a jug with feet under the roof, pull up on crimps to a mantle move and follow crack systems to the top of the wall. The crux is low and not well protected.
content.protection: Not good down low, medium nuts and cams for the upper section.

content.description: Corner on South-East side of Guillotine. This is #49 in Swartling/Mayer book 3rd ed.
content.protection: Setting top-rope here is a little tricky. It's on the top of the tower which is one solid boulder.
content.location: Walk up the CCC trail to the Guillotine climbs - above the Guillotine Wall. Walk around to the back side to find this corner.

content.description: Start in front of the tower. Pull a flake for the start. Choose either the right crack or left and pull the overhang leading to the summit. Down climb the back side to get off and walk back around.
content.protection: small to medium gear. Large Sling for the top.
content.location: From the Guillotine Head up and right and you will see the tower. Around the corner from "The Pike'

content.description: The crux is the very beginning of the route.  you have to pull yourself over a slight overhang, and once you get up to a ledge above that you just follow some easy lines to the top.
content.protection: sling some trees, and nuts or hexes in cracks at the top work well.
content.location: The corner just left of the Layback and Broken Boulders.  Starts with a slight overhang.

content.description: Hug the outside corner while making big moves on small footholds.
content.protection: Plenty of trees and boulders to build a solid top rope anchor.
content.location: The route is to the left of Beginner's Chimney. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Pass Broken Boulders and look for the obvious chimney to the right. Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Start to the right of Broken Boulders on a slanting ledge and join the main route. A fun easy route.
content.protection: Light rack, cracks on top to build an anchor.
content.location: The route is approximately in the center of the Guillotine Wall. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Broken Boulders starts just past the 5.7 corner. Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Starting just to the right of a 5.7 corner follow the line of boulders to the top.  A good variation is to start to the right on a slanting ledge and join the main route.  A fun easy route.
content.protection: Light rack, cracks on top to build an anchor.Large trees available for building top rope anchors using cordalettes and static line.
content.location: The route is approximately in the center of the Guillotine Wall.  Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5).  Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner).  Broken Boulders starts just past the 5.7 corner.  Walk off to the left,  head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Easy nose climb, watch out for the toads that like hanging out in the holds on the right :)
content.protection: Plenty of trees and boulders to build a solid top rope anchor.
content.location: The route is to the right of Beginner's Chimney. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Pass Broken Boulders and the chimney to the right. Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Climb 4 feet onto first ledge and then up left corner.
content.protection: Plenty of trees and boulders to build a solid top rope anchor.
content.location: The route is to the right of Beginner's Nose. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Pass Broken Boulders and the chimney to the right. Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: Climb the obvious chimney to the right of Broken Boulders.  Not as good for the grade as Broken Boulders but still fun.  I should give it one more star because the climbers in the photo are clearly having a good time.
content.protection: Light rack, cracks on top to build an anchor.  Break out your big stuff if you want.
content.location: The route is three routes to the right of Broken Boulders. Coming in from the west walk along the base passing an outside corner (Poison Ivy 5.5). Here the base becomes a ledge, walk along this slightly exposed ledge to the next outside corner (5.7 corner). Pass Broken Boulders and look for the obvious chimney to the right.  Walk off to the left, head left and down before you reach the Monster Wall.

content.description: This is a fun face and crack route.  Ample protection for a beginning leader but building an anchor on top could be exciting for a beginning leader.  This could be the third pitch of a Guillotine ridge route.
content.location: This route is on the southern most tower of the Guillotine (this is the upper or third level of the Guillotine Area).  It goes up the center of the east face of this tower.  To get down you can downclimb to the northeast and hop over to northeast tower for an easy scramble or lower one on one side and the other(s) rap off the opposite side.

content.description: A nice 5.7 with plenty of pro.
content.location: Crack to overhang left of Rhus Toxicodendron Radicans.

content.description:
The Guillotine and the Guillotine Wall are two smaller formations found at the east end of the East Rampart, above the No Sweat area.  This area has lots of short and easy climbs, as well as a few nice routes of moderate difficulty.   

  Because it has easy access, easy routes, and is separate from the main East Rampart scene, it is popular for climbing classes and groups of beginners. It tends to either be full of people, or empty.  

  The area is also good for linking up multi-pitch routes of three or even four small pitches, starting from the CCC Trail below No Sweat and ending east of D'Arcy's Buttress.
